1. Aniridia: A condition characterized by the partial or complete absence of the iris (the colored part of the eye).
2. Peters anomaly: A rare genetic disorder that affects the development of the eyes, leading to abnormalities in the shape and size of the eyes, as well as vision problems.
3. Autosomal dominant keratitis: A condition where the cornea (the clear outer layer of the eye) becomes inflamed and damaged, leading to vision problems.
4. Familial foveal dysplasia: A rare genetic disorder that affects the development of the retina (the light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye), leading to vision problems and blindness.
